__TOC__

This is Firebird 3.0.x is imported from debian testing <nowiki>[[http://packages.debian.org/source/testing/firebird3.0|repository]]</nowiki> 

The stable package (version 3.0.x) for Ubuntu LTS releases is located into <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~mapopa/+archive/firebird3.0|this]]</nowiki> repository (ppa)

The repository must be added this way, 

<pre>
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:mapopa/firebird3.0
sudo apt-get update
</pre>

Here is how you can inspect the firebird3.0 related packages

<pre>
apt-cache search firebird3.0
</pre>

Install the super server package (you will be asked about the SYSDBA password) 

<pre>
sudo apt-get install firebird3.0-server
The following extra packages will be installed:
  firebird3.0-common firebird3.0-common-doc firebird3.0-utils libfbclient2 libib-util
Suggested packages:
  firebird3.0-doc
The following NEW packages will be installed:
  firebird3.0-common firebird3.0-common-doc firebird3.0-server firebird3.0-utils libfbclient2 libib-util
0 upgraded, 6 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Need to get 4,889kB of archives.
After this operation, 13.1MB of additional disk space will be used.
Do you want to continue [Y/n]?
</pre>

You need to configure the package after is installed
<pre>
sudo dpkg-reconfigure firebird3.0-server
</pre>

Install the examples and dev files 
<pre>
sudo apt-get install firebird3.0-examples firebird-dev 
</pre>

The employee.fdb archive will be under this dir
/usr/share/doc/firebird3.0-examples/examples/empbuild/

<pre>
cd /usr/share/doc/firebird3.0-examples/examples/empbuild/
sudo gunzip employee.fdb.gz
sudo chown firebird.firebird employee.fdb
sudo mv employee.fdb /var/lib/firebird/3.0/data/
</pre>

Connect to database using the isql-fb console

<pre>
$ isql-fb
SQL> connect "/var/lib/firebird/3.0/data/employee.fdb " user 'SYSDBA' password 'SYSDBApassword';
</pre>
If all is ok then you will have the message with what database connected and what user and ready to use 
sql prompt 
<pre>
Database:  "/var/lib/firebird/3.0/data/employee.fdb ", User: SYSDBA
SQL> </pre>

Now you can check the server version and the tables

<pre>
SQL> show tables;
       COUNTRY                                CUSTOMER
       DEPARTMENT                             EMPLOYEE
       EMPLOYEE_PROJECT                       JOB
       PROJECT                                PROJ_DEPT_BUDGET
       SALARY_HISTORY                         SALES

SQL> show version;
ISQL Version: LI-T3.0.0.28869 Firebird 3.0 Unstable
Server version:
Firebird/Linux/AMD/Intel/x64 (access method), version "LI-T3.0.0.28869 Firebird 3.0 Unstable"
Firebird/Linux/AMD/Intel/x64 (remote server), version "LI-T3.0.0.28869 Firebird 3.0 Unstable/tcp (borkstationx64)/P13"
Firebird/Linux/AMD/Intel/x64 (remote interface), version "LI-T3.0.0.28869 Firebird 3.0 Unstable/tcp (borkstationx64)/P13"
on disk structure version 12.0</pre>

To create a new database 
<pre>
SQL> create database "/var/lib/firebird/3.0/data/first_database.fdb" user 'SYSDBA' password 'SYSDBAPASSWORD';
SQL> connect "/var/lib/firebird/3.0/data/first_database.fdb" user 'SYSDBA' password 'masterkey';
Commit current transaction (y/n)?y
Committing.
Database:  "/var/lib/firebird/3.0/data/first_database.fdb", User: SYSDBA
SQL>
</pre>
If you want to create a simple table then insert 1-2 rows and select from it here is one example

<pre>
SQL> CREATE TABLE TEST (ID INT NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY, NAME VARCHAR(20));
SQL> show tables;
       TEST
SQL> INSERT INTO TEST VALUES (1, 'John');
SQL> INSERT INTO TEST VALUES (2, 'Joe');
SQL> select * from test;

          ID NAME                 
============ ==================== 
           1 John                 
           2 Joe 
</pre>

To quit the isql-fb console type quit 

<pre>
SQL> quit
CON>; 
</pre>

For a good open source GUI admin tool you might check the flamerobin administration tool included in ubuntu repository can be installed by an simple 
<pre>
sudo apt-get install flamerobin
</pre>

Then use it from the menu Applications->Programming-> FlameRobin 

To use firebird with php , you will need the php5 driver

<pre>
sudo apt-get install php5-interbase libapache2-mod-php5
sudo php5enmod interbase
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
</pre>
Next if you need to install an php administration tool like Firebird Web Admin 

<pre>
sudo apt-get install git-core
git clone git://github.com/mariuz/firebirdwebadmin.git 
mv firebirdwebadmin /var/www/html/firebirdwebadmin
</pre>

and load it in the browser <nowiki>[[http://localhost/firebirdwebadmin|http://localhost/firebirdwebadmin]]</nowiki>

It should look like this <nowiki>[[https://plus.google.com/photos/yourphotos?pid=6150124576638928626&oid=105567297772267099132 |screen shot]]</nowiki> 

== Other Firebird Related Guides ==

You can start with the main Firebird <nowiki>[[http://www.firebirdsql.org/en/documentation/|documentation]]</nowiki>. 

To use Ruby language with firebird I wrote a <nowiki>[[http://mapopa.blogspot.com/2009/02/fireruby-howto-start-with-firebird-and.html | tutorial]]</nowiki> on howto install the stable driver.

For Ruby on Rails i wrote <nowiki>[[http://mapopa.blogspot.com/2009/02/installing-firebird-active-record-for.html |howto]]</nowiki> install the Firebird Active Record Adapter and start <nowiki>[[http://mapopa.blogspot.com/2009/02/rails-on-firebird-status-after-adapter.html | an application]]</nowiki>. 

To use python you must use <nowiki>[[http://pypi.python.org/pypi/fdb/ | the official ]]</nowiki> stable firebird python driver and <nowiki>[[http://pythonhosted.org/fdb/ | here]]</nowiki> is howto install and use the driver.

For <nowiki>[[http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/lucid/man1/lazarus-ide.1.html|Lazarus IDE]]</nowiki> i wrote an <nowiki>[[http://mapopa.blogspot.com/2010/04/using-lazarus-ide-with-firebird-in.html | visual guide]]</nowiki>  on howto use the database aware components in a simple application that uses Firebird.

Lua Language does have a <nowiki>[[http://code.google.com/p/fbclient/|good driver]]</nowiki> and there is a <nowiki>[[http://mapopa.blogspot.com/2010/04/getting-started-with-firebird-and-lua.html|Getting started]]</nowiki> guide with firebird on ubuntu

Server Side Javascript is served with the help of a pure Javascript <nowiki>[[https://npmjs.org/package/node-firebird | nodejs driver]]</nowiki>
